subject: Productivity
title: Bounded Rationality
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Bounded Rationality.

hook.text: Classical economics assumed humans are perfectly rational. Herbert Simon proved that was fiction.

buildup.text: Simon argued that brains have limited time, information, and processing power for any given choice.

discovery.text: He called this bounded rationality: we're rational within limits, not without them.

twist.text: This means most decisions aren't optimal. They're satisfactory â€” good enough given the constraints.

climax.text: Simon won the Nobel Prize for showing that real decisions happen under fog, not spotlight.

punchline.text: Perfect decisions are a myth. Good enough is real.

quiz.question: What is bounded rationality?
options: Rationality limited by time, information, and processing power
A theory that humans are perfectly logical
